title: When you accidentally take the ADCs kills and they rage at you all game.
body:
You take it calmly as you can throughout the game and wait until game ends then finally snap.

http://media.giphy.com/media/qhyQfm8GBkWaY/giphy.gif

replies.body: I once had to support a {{champion:222}}  who couldn't dodge {{champion:51}}  qs. I was {{champion:37}}  and she blamed me for staying back and not tanking them. some people... -.-
I once supported an {{champion:81}} as {{champion:44}} and he raged at me for 'healing myself' whenever I healed him.
That's like raging at Sona for healing the wrong person...
Didn't they add something vague to one of her moves, where it attacks "targeted" champions or something?
Sona W (heal only hit champions) and her Q prioritizes champions if they are within range and it hits the closest champions/minions
I know the pain man. . .I know the pain.

I once played {{champion:412}} and my ADC {{champion:119}} was raging hardcore at me for not letting him "pick up the souls" and I'm the reason he's dying because he's not getting armour from the souls.
That is just. . .lol that is the bronzest sounding ADC I've heard in ages, and I'm in bronze!
{{champion:37}}

I don't even...
WHAT!?

you think that's something... no... no..no... it was 30mins into the game and as the jungler i took my red buff...BIG MISTAKE, the adc  got so pissed that he stayed in the jungle and afk farmed, flaming at the team because i took red buff.... the sad part is, we were crushing the other team, we were fucking winning.

but we lost without him

As an ADC main this hurts... I dont complain about support getting kills.. as long as the enemy ADC dies we still pull ahead... 
I dunno what elo you people talking about...
Most all of them. Being an adc, you don't have to play with your counterparts. Thank you for not being an insufferable child.

Neither do I. As long as they let me farm, I'm fine. 

That being said, if I'm 2/4/9 as ADC, and my support is 9/0/2, it gets a bit disheartening.

Its not a specific elo per say, but just some people have this kind of attitude and mentality. You see a lot more of this coming from low elo like bronze, silver, and low gold. Thats not to say you can't have a diamond player who acts this way as well. Its not very common, but its not out of the question.

Well seeing as how most people are silver and bronze...like 70% of the game....If you aren't seeing it, you probably aren't bronze or silver and thus don't make for a good comparison. Cant use the top 25% of the game to say certain things aren't happening to the the other 75% of us.  I get adc's that rage all the time because I chose to kill the person they were fighting as opposed to possibly letting them die.  The meta is what creates these monsters.  For 5 seasons they have been told they are the most important person in the game.  Surely you can see how some people take that as a license to be a douche....cuz they are important...the meta says so......
I just leave bot and go roam
Not if the adc is {{champion:429}}

> [{quoted}](name=5000000000000000,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=Y967bm29,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-04-19T17:23:12.240+0000)
>
> Not if the adc is {{champion:429}}

Yup. If kalista wants to be able to use more than just rend, she better stfu and thank me for helping her get to late game.
http://st.elohell.net/public/chill/757e63a115389f303af5168033054fbe.jpg
And that was ADC Urgot in his prime.
well that makes sense

{{champion:143}}  that feel when I block a thresh hook or sometimes a blitz grab with an emergency plant block, and my adc cusses me out for giving their adc the free plant gold. In fact, just generally getting told off for giving an enemy "free farm" when it zones them off the wave for upwards of 6 seconds.
OH NO WATCH OUT THEY HAVE 5 GOLD GG WE LOSE REPORT ZYRA
lol yeah cuz that 5 gold is totally gonna make them snowball....lol

As soraka...
Heal (250hp), starcall, heal (250hp), silence, heal (250), starcall, heal (250). My EZ  is now at 100 hp left on 800 maximum hp. Despite my 1k heals. the second part of my silence kill the enemy ADC... 

My EZ throw a tantrum at me saying i'm a KSer and i'm worthless... happens all the times...
{{champion:81}}  problems.....

Once I was playing {{champion:53}} supporting a {{champion:22}}  who overextended EVERY TIME. She then proceeded to rage at me for not tanking for her.

Then, when the team was grouping in mid, she overextended bot again and blamed me for not being a "support".

She then proceeded to flame the team for "leaving their lanes".

{{summoner:3}}

Had an Ezreal player (my #1 hated ADC to play with) rage on me all game for picking Voli support.

You could tell he was seething. He missed a creep, he would then type in "fk voli" and constantly berate me.

Then we got dove on and he died, I got 3 kills and he snapped. "YOU'RE NOT EVEN A FKN SUPPORT YOU'RE JUST A VOLIBEAR BOTTOM"

Yes. Yes, I was. He sulked all game. I carried. I wasn't the support he wanted. I was the support he needed.

{{champion:106}}: I'm the Support this Rift Deserves, just not the one it needs right now.


(Bonus) {{champion:81}}: So you think the Thunder is your Ally...?

I love playing Voli "Support" I just build full tank with some Mobi boots and then I just eat people. It's great.

I had a mid nidalee yesterday get mad because bottom turret fell and I left to ward the map.  She then afk'd the rest of the game.  The struggle as a support main is real.  And the adc's I get......lol.  If I tell you I'm going b to buy wards, that doesn't mean you push the lane 1 vs 2 with no vision till I return.  Then when they get 3 man gangbanged for overextending alone, its....."where's my support"  "where are the wards".  ADC's don't see anything but minions.  ADC's are entitled little pricks that have been catered to for 5 seasons now that feels like everyone in the game owes them something.  The way the meta is set up makes it easy for adcs to feel like they are the chosen ones....even though its rarely the adc who wins the game for us in the games I play.  How hard is it to get strong when someone sits in lane with you and heals you, wards for you, takes shots for you, and lets you have all the freaking minions?  The meta makes ADC's feel like gods gift to this game.  IJS.

I've mained every role and I concur.

Supports have it rough, everyone expects the support to spam Heals like they're URF Sona. Or Tank Everything Like they're a Level 30 Cho'gath with 6 stacks, {{item:2138}},  and a Pure tank Build.

And they expect you to be able to have 20 Wards out at once despite the 3Stealth, 1Pink wardlimit for EVERY PLAYER.
Nami bounce heal kills are real
I don't own Nami, but I played her a lot on free week and noticed I'd get phantom kills while doing nothing but using W and E on key allies. I suppose this is why.

Played {{champion:111}} support with a {{champion:222}} the other day, went 12/6/16 with more kills than Jinx by the end of the game and she never bothered me about it once. That game felt like absolute bliss, let me tell you.

> [{quoted}](name=Aych Pii,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=Y967bm29,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2015-04-20T11:01:49.321+0000)
>
> Played {{champion:111}} support with a {{champion:222}} the other day, went 12/6/16 with more kills than Jinx by the end of the game and she never bothered me about it once. That game felt like absolute bliss, let me tell you.

Yeah, never ceases to amaze me that you can completely blow out the enemy bot and be dominating the game, but if you're support and have more kills there's still those people that just rage at you.

It's like, OMG we're fkn WINNING Y U SO BAD
...Permission to use GIF later?
When you steal your ADC's kill and they say its ok
It is a pain though when you get a garen supp and they decide to steal all your kills so you cant even do anything late game
Big hint, he isn't playing support.

> [{quoted}](name=Fredart,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=Y967bm29,comment-id=00080001,timestamp=2015-04-20T19:06:01.287+0000)
>
> Big hint, he isn't playing support.

Figured that out but I can't do anything when he locks in -_-
Just look at it as a mini-game where getting that last hit is just slightly harder. Maybe ask your support why hes a republican and doesn't like welfare.

kills aren't going to win you the game.

Just cs if you can. If Garen takes those too, then... whelp. At least assists give gold too...?
who said it was accidental kappa

I stole my adc's 9th kill of the game because I thought they were going to get away
Needless to say my adc raged at me for it for some reason
Then I "stole" 1 cs with relic shield and she left the game as 8/0/1 {{champion:51}} 
Needless to say that game went well...
Teammates who don't understand what a Relic Shield is (At least at later levels,) Should probably stop playing.

I only care about kills when its the first 5 kills of the game.
Since those kills generally snowball the fuck out of anyone with an early item.
If a support takes those I get pissed but only if it was givable to an ally.
Obviously if they're the ONLY one able to pick it up I'll gladly take assist gold over nothing at all.

Situations are different every game.

I was supporting a Tristana as Volibear today, she was able to pick up two kills in the first 5 minutes thanks to my Q, Exhaust, E combo.  We both backed, I picked up a sightstone and placed wards at all the key spots.  Somehow she missed the enemy jungler rolling into the lane and found herself surrounded 3 vs 1.  I ran in with my ultimate, killed all 3 of them, and she was able to make it out alive.  She then promptly accused me of stealing her kills IN ALL CAPS.  I was so put off by her behavior that I told her "good luck soloing bot" and proceeded to duo top lane.  We wrecked top and won the game without her.

Having played all of the roles, I've learned to treat my supports and junglers with as much respect as they deserve.

The day I discovered the "mute" button was a very very good day #fucktoxicplayers

Here's the way that I look at things: it's the support's job to help the team, however they can.  Help a teammate survive, or help them pick up a kill is what everyone expects the support to limit themselves to.  In MY eyes, however, helping the team DOES include grabbing the occasional kill.  If nothing else, look at it as "one less enemy for us to fight for a few seconds while we push other objectives."  Is that really SO hard?
